result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADA Frank Remington appeared for the State. Attorney Brian Walter Gleason appeared in person on behalf of Defn. Attorney Gleason to update the Court after Preliminary Hearings on September 20th in other cases.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 2

10:47 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Brian Walter Gleason.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Received a call from supervisor of the group home that defn is located requesting defn to appear by phone/Zoom. Court will leave prelim as scheduled for now. If counsel is not appointed by week before hearing, hearing will be changed to telephone status conf.
Defn qualifies for SPD but no appointment has been made as of yet; 6-30-22 status conference will be canceled; hearing to be set further down the road to hopefully have atty on board

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.

IN CUSTODY 



03:14 PM Defendant Adarrius A Findley in court. Prosecuting Atty Robin W Lee appeared for State of Wisconsin.  SPD has not appointed counsel yet.   Defendant has asked for bail mod.  Court's understanding is that he will go to an ATR in Milwaukee if he gets a sig bond.  CT: amends to $500 signature bond. All other conditions remain as previously set.
SPD appointment status

**** IN CUSTODY ***

11:33 AM Defendant appeared.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing has not been held and case not bound over. Defn has applied for SPD and an attorney has not yet been appointed. A Motion has not been filed to Modify Bail.
Bail/bond hearing on May 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Adarrius A Findley in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin. DE states he has qualified for SPD appointment, counsel has not been appointed at this time. Court finds good cause, sets over hearing to 5-25-22 at 3pm. DE states request for bail modification. State objects, not Ch. 950 compliant. Court to send note to trial branch.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
